Weighted LDA Models

Source: vignettes/pkgdown_files/Weighted_LDA.Rmd
Weighted_LDA.Rmd

Weighted LDA

We use the text data we prepared for the base keyATM (see Preparation).

library(keyATM)
library(quanteda)
library(magrittr)
data(data_corpus_inaugural, package = "quanteda")

data_tokens <- tokens(data_corpus_inaugural,
                      remove_numbers = TRUE,
                      remove_punct = TRUE,
                      remove_symbols = TRUE,
                      remove_separators = TRUE,
                      remove_url = TRUE) %>%
                 tokens_tolower() %>%
                 tokens_remove(c(stopwords("english"),
                               "may", "shall", "can",
                               "must", "upon", "with", "without")) %>%
                 tokens_select(min_nchar = 3)

data_dfm <- dfm(data_tokens) %>%
              dfm_trim(min_termfreq = 5, min_docfreq = 2)

keyATM_docs <- keyATM_read(texts = data_dfm)
out <- weightedLDA(docs              = keyATM_docs,    # text input
                   number_of_topics  = 5,              # number of topics without keywords
                   model             = "base",         # select the model
                   options           = list(seed = 250))
top_words(out)
##    Topic_1      Topic_2  Topic_3    Topic_4    Topic_5
## 1    world       states    every government     people
## 2   nation constitution     good      great     public
## 3      new        union    years    country government
## 4   people       united      men        one   congress
## 5  freedom       rights  justice      power       laws
## 6  america     citizens    never       made  interests
## 7    peace          war      law     spirit      among
## 8      let        state  liberty       just    foreign
## 9     life       powers     time       best     policy
## 10     now    executive national      right        now

Weighted LDA Covariates

We use the covariate data we prepared for the covariate keyATM (see keyATM_cov).

vars <- docvars(data_corpus_inaugural)

library(dplyr)
vars %>%
  as_tibble() %>%
  mutate(Period = case_when(Year <= 1899 ~ "18_19c",
                            TRUE ~ "20_21c")) %>%
  mutate(Party = case_when(Party == "Democratic" ~ "Democratic",
                           Party == "Republican" ~ "Republican",
                           TRUE ~ "Other")) %>%
  select(Party, Period) -> vars_selected

vars_selected %>%
  mutate(Party  = factor(Party,
                         levels = c("Other", "Republican", "Democratic")),
         Period = factor(Period,
                         levels = c("18_19c", "20_21c"))) -> vars_selected
out <- weightedLDA(docs              = keyATM_docs,
                   number_of_topics  = 5,
                   model             = "covariates",
                   model_settings    = list(covariates_data    = vars_selected,
                                            covariates_formula = ~ Party + Period),
                   options           = list(seed = 250))
top_words(out)
##    Topic_1      Topic_2    Topic_3  Topic_4   Topic_5
## 1    world   government     nation    great    people
## 2      new       states      peace     made     power
## 3   people       public government      one     union
## 4  nations      country   american congress  citizens
## 5  freedom constitution       make      law    rights
## 6  america        every        men    right      best
## 7     time       united       life     well      duty
## 8      let         laws    justice     free interests
## 9      now    political       hope    among     state
## 10   every       powers       good     many   foreign

Weighted LDA Dynamic

We use the time index we prepared for the dynamic keyATM (see keyATM_dynamic).

vars %>%
  as_tibble() %>%
  mutate(Period = (vars$Year - 1780) %/% 10 + 1) -> vars_period
out <- weightedLDA(docs             = keyATM_docs,
                   number_of_topics = 3,
                   model            = "dynamic",
                   model_settings   = list(time_index = vars_period$Period,
                                           num_states = 5),
                   options          = list(seed = 250))
top_words(out)
##     Topic_1  Topic_2      Topic_3
## 1   country    world   government
## 2     every   nation       states
## 3     power   people       people
## 4  citizens    peace        great
## 5       one      new       public
## 6     union     time constitution
## 7       war  nations       united
## 8      made  freedom     national
## 9      just  america       rights
## 10     best american     congress
